At this time installation requires a [http://subversion.tigris.org/ subversion] client.

= Installation =

To install create a folder (module) named `django_apps` with an `__init__.py` file somewhere on your python path (such as `Lib/site-packages`). From within that new folder run:

{{{
svn checkout http://django-photologue.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/photologue/ photologue
}}}

Add the app your installed_apps setting:

{{{
INSTALLED_APPS = (
    # other installed apps
    'django_apps.photologue',
)
}}}

Add this to `yourproject.urls`:

{{{
urlpatterns += patterns('',
	(r'^photologue/', include('django_apps.photologue.urls')),
)
}}}

Optionally, create a new `PhotoSize` through the Django admin or shell named `thumbnail` and you will get thumbnail previews in the admin interface.

From the shell:
{{{
from django_apps.photologue.models import PhotoSize
PhotoSize.objects.create(name='thumbnail', width=100, height=75)
}}}

Check out the [http://code.google.com/p/django-photologue/wiki/TemplateExamples example templates] into one of your TEMPLATE_DIRS and modify as needed.

Be sure your MEDIA_URL and MEDIA_ROOT settings are correct.
